issue.title: `_sqlAliasManager` unexpectedly `null` in `SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubquery()` call after previous call of `SelectExpression.Update()`

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
An existing `SelectExpression` is "updated" in `SqlNullabilityProcessor.Visit(SelectExpression selectExpression, bool visitProjection)` via a call to `SelectExpression.Update(...)`.

On that resulting `SelectExpression`, we later call `SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubquery()`.

Because `SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubquery()` uses `_sqlAliasManager` internally, and `SelectExpression.Update(...)` does not retain the `SqlAliasManager`  instance of the original `SelectExpression`, `_sqlAliasManager` is `null` in the `SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubquery()` call and an unexpected/implicit NRE is thrown.

### Include provider and version information

EF Core version: 9.0.0
Database provider: Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

issue.title: IBM EntityFramework Core: .NET9.0 upgrade: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
### Bug description

Hi,
We are in progress to support .NET 9 via IBM Entity Framework Core provider, but we observed some failures, one of them is: 
While running simple skip query we are hitting Null Reference Exception.
Linq Query: 
`var q = ctx.Customers.Distinct().OrderBy(c => c.CustomerID);
Console.WriteLine("Total records after skip: " + q.Skip(5).Count());`

Exception Stack Trace:
dbug: 1/27/2025 06:38:48.981 CoreEventId.QueryCompilationStarting[10111] (Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query)
      Compiling query expression:
      'DbSet<Customer>()
          .Distinct()
          .OrderBy(c => c.CustomerID)
          .Skip(__p_0)
          .Count()'
Unhandled exception. System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.SqlExpressions.SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubqueryInternal(Boolean liftOrderings) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore.Relational\Query\SqlExpressions\SelectExpression.cs:line 3468
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.SqlExpressions.SelectExpression.PushdownIntoSubquery() in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore.Relational\Query\SqlExpressions\SelectExpression.cs:line 3459
   at IBM.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Sql.Internal.Db2QuerySqlGenerator.Db2RowNumberPagingExpressionVisitor.VisitSelectExpression(Expression expression) in C:\DBCTRepo\NET9_master_Development_27Nov\src\IBM.EntityFrameworkCore\Query\Sql\Internal\Db2QuerySqlGenerator.cs:line 870
   at IBM.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Sql.Internal.Db2QuerySqlGenerator.Db2RowNumberPagingExpressionVisitor.Visit(Expression selectExpression) in C:\DBCTRepo\NET9_master_Development_27Nov\src\IBM.EntityFrameworkCore\Query\Sql\Internal\Db2QuerySqlGenerator.cs:line 847
   at IBM.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Sql.Internal.Db2QuerySqlGenerator.Db2RowNumberPagingExpressionVisitor.VisitSelectExpression(Expression expression) in C:\DBCTRepo\NET9_master_Development_27Nov\src\IBM.EntityFrameworkCore\Query\Sql\Internal\Db2QuerySqlGenerator.cs:line 907
   at IBM.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Sql.Internal.Db2QuerySqlGenerator.Db2RowNumberPagingExpressionVisitor.Visit(Expression selectExpression) in C:\DBCTRepo\NET9_master_Development_27Nov\src\IBM.EntityFrameworkCore\Query\Sql\Internal\Db2QuerySqlGenerator.cs:line 847
   at IBM.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.Db2QueryTranslationPostprocessor.Process(Expression query) in C:\DBCTRepo\NET9_master_Development_27Nov\src\IBM.EntityFrameworkCore\Query\Internal\Db2QueryTranslationPostprocessor.cs:line 51
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryCompilationContext.CreateQueryExecutorExpression[TResult](Expression query) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\QueryCompilationContext.cs:line 258
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.QueryCompilationContext.CreateQueryExecutor[TResult](Expression query) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\QueryCompilationContext.cs:line 224
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Database.CompileQuery[TResult](Expression query, Boolean async) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Storage\Database.cs:line 66
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.CompileQueryCore[TResult](IDatabase database, Expression query, IModel model, Boolean async) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\QueryCompiler.cs:line 127
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.<>c__DisplayClass11_0`1.<ExecuteCore>b__0() in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\QueryCompiler.cs:line 83
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.CompiledQueryCache.GetOrAddQuery[TResult](Object cacheKey, Func`1 compiler) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\CompiledQueryCache.cs:line 64
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.ExecuteCore[TResult](Expression query, Boolean async, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\QueryCompiler.cs:line 79
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.QueryCompiler.Execute[TResult](Expression query) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\QueryCompiler.cs:line 60
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Query.Internal.EntityQueryProvider.Execute[TResult](Expression expression) in C:\Users\asoni\Desktop\efcore-9.0.0\src\EFCore\Query\Internal\EntityQueryProvider.cs:line 62
   at Program.<Main>$(String[] args) in C:\Users\asoni\source\repos\NET9DebugConsApp1\NET9DebugConsApp1\Program.cs:line 10

----------------------------------------

**On doing further investigation we found:**
 private SqlRemappingVisitor PushdownIntoSubqueryInternal(bool liftOrderings = true)
 {
     // If there's just one table in the select being pushed down, bubble up that table's name as the subquery's alias.
     var subqueryAlias =
         _sqlAliasManager.GenerateTableAlias(_tables is [{ Alias: string singleTableAlias }] ? singleTableAlias : "subquery");
....
....
}
**Here _sqlAliasManager is Null** 
bcoz it gets call from update method of SelectExpression class which internally call following constructor without passing reference of SqlAliasManager 
`public SelectExpression Update(
    IReadOnlyList<TableExpressionBase> tables,
    SqlExpression? predicate,
    IReadOnlyList<SqlExpression> groupBy,
    SqlExpression? having,
    IReadOnlyList<ProjectionExpression> projections,
    IReadOnlyList<OrderingExpression> orderings,
    SqlExpression? offset,
    SqlExpression? limit)
{
....
....
var newSelectExpression = new SelectExpression(
    Alias, tables, predicate, groupBy, having, projections, IsDistinct, orderings, offset, limit,
    (IReadOnlySet<string>)Tags, Annotations)
{
    _projectionMapping = projectionMapping, _clientProjections = _clientProjections.ToList()
};
...
...
}

 public SelectExpression(
     string? alias,
     IReadOnlyList<TableExpressionBase> tables,
     SqlExpression? predicate,
     IReadOnlyList<SqlExpression> groupBy,
     SqlExpression? having,
     IReadOnlyList<ProjectionExpression> projections,
     bool distinct,
     IReadOnlyList<OrderingExpression> orderings,
     SqlExpression? offset,
     SqlExpression? limit,
     IReadOnlySet<string>? tags = null,
     IReadOnlyDictionary<string, IAnnotation>? annotations = null,
     SqlAliasManager? sqlAliasManager = null)
     : this(
         alias, tables.ToList(), predicate, groupBy.ToList(), having, projections.ToList(), distinct, orderings.ToList(),
         offset, limit, tags?.ToHashSet() ?? [], annotations, sqlAliasManager: sqlAliasManager, isMutable: false)
`
As we can see from update method we don't pass reference for SqlAliasManager that causes null assignment as null is default value as per the constructor definition and inside PushdownIntoSubqueryInternal method without checking null we are invoking its method..

this is causing several testcases break and we require fix or alternate solution to proceed in supporting .NET 9.

### Your code

```csharp
var q = ctx.Customers.Distinct().OrderBy(c => c.CustomerID);
Console.WriteLine("Total records after skip: " + q.Skip(5).Count());
```

### Stack traces

```text

```

### Verbose output

```text

```

### EF Core version

9.0.1

### Database provider

IBM Entity Framework Core

### Target framework

.NET 9.0

### Operating system

Windows 10

### IDE

_No response_

issue.title: Ensure all SelectExpressions always have a SqlAliasManager

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
The SQL alias refactoring work in 9.0 assumed that only mutable SelectExpressions need a SqlAliasManager, which is incorrect: pushdown may be called on immutable SelectExpressions later in the query pipeline (e.g. SqlNullabilityProcessor). This means that even our immutable SelectExpressions aren't really fully immutable (again a blurring of the mutability line which we need to get rid of).

In the meantime, this PR ensures that **all** SelectExpressions always have SqlAliasManager, regardless of whether they're (supposedly) mutable or not.

/cc @lauxjpn @ChrisJollyAU. As you've worked around this issue in 9 in your providers, and we've gotten only one user report, I'll hold back proposing this for backporting in a patch. But we can revisit that based on user feedback.

Fixes #35507

rename.from: Null Reference due to missing sqlAliasManager due to double nullable optimisation
rename.to: Null Reference due to missing sqlAliasManager in SelectExpression

body: We are experiencing this issue as well.
